task.title: Editing Class Parameters in the PE console
task.shortdesc: You can use the PE console to set or edit the values of a class' parameters without needing to edit the module's code directly. In this procedure, you will use the PE conosle to edit parameters on the apache class.

step.cmd: From the console, click Classification in the navigation bar.
From the Classification page, click the apache_example group.
Click the Classes tab, and find apache in the list of classes.
From the Parameter name drop-down list, choose the parameter you'd like to edit. (For this example, we will use docroot.
step.info: Note: The grey text that appears as values for some parameters is the default value, which can be either a literal value or a Puppet variable. You can restore this value by selecting Discard Changes after you have added the parameter.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Live Management page, and select the Control Puppet tab.
Click runonce and then Run to trigger a Puppet run to have PE create the new configuration.
